ext_descriptions.ext_description: Observation_date_time is used to record the date or date and time of the Observation.

The observed_context links to entities that define the context in which the observation is made. The entities which may be used to define the context are defined in a higher level module that uses this one.
observing_person allows a person or person in organization to be associated to the . The role of the person is noted in the . The usual role will be that of "observer".

observation_recorder points to the entities that can be identified as recording observational information. By default, this is an identifiable piece of equipment, represented through a , however the list of entities may be extended through a higher level module.

An Observation is an historical record of something that has occured during the life of a product or its support environment. Its use is restricted to observations not directly represented in the data model, and should not be used where some other reporting data structure is defined.

an Observation is always an observation about something, and that something is referenced by the Observation.applies_to attribute. The entities which it may be applied to are defined using a higher level module. A maintenance procedure may raise an observation on the product, the product design, the maintenence manual, the schedule, the resources (both intended and actual), the task itself, and so on.
provides a free text field in which to describe the Observation, and so allows the recording of significant information which is not otherwise allowed for.

an identifier for the Observation The identifier should be unique over the set of virtual, extended and real enterprises that may exchange observations. There is no useful way of formally specifying this scope.

allows the identification of the context in which the observation is made. the entities which may be used to define the context are defined in a higher level module that uses this one. A problem is found during a maintenance operation. The set of contexts can include the equipment being maintained, the end product the equipment is fitted to, the activity being undertaken, the manual that describes the activity and the resources being used.
the name of the Observation

a physical piece of equipment that recorded observation data. By default this is a piece of physical equipment, represented by . One use of this entity is to provide a link between health monitoring equipment and the file it produces (recorded as a ).

a link to a defined that was being performed when the observation was made. An unexpected problem may be found during a maintenance activity, in which case the is the maintenance activity itself. Aircraft health monitoring data is collected during a flight. The flight profile may be recorded using the . Some business rules may require that an observation is always made against an , while others may not require that the activity be recorded.

those entities which contain information relevant to the Observation The "Observation" entity asserts that, at the time the Observation was recorded, these entities and the information they contain are relevant to the Observation. This creates two operational problems: firstly, what happens when the information content of the record changes, and secondly, what is the extent of the information that the Observation.related_records applies to - just the entity pointed to, or the entity plus any other associated entities, as for example, when the entity is a product, does the Observation also refer to its product structure? These issues should be addressed by business rules, and are outside the scope of this standard.

An Observation_consequence is an association of an observation to the consequences that follow from it, where those consequences are in the form of a . One of the uses of Observation_consequence is to close one of the feedback loops from the use of a product to requests for its enhancements.
the identifier of the Observation_consequence.

a name for the Observation_consequence.
the that the consequence entails.

the role Observation_consequence plays in the link between the and the it raises. The roles played by Observation_consequence are defined though business rules, and may be identified through reference data.

An Observation_item is a reference to any item that an observation can be made about, or any item that can be used as part of the observation.
An observation can refer to any entity represented in the schema it is used in, from products to property values, or actions to task steps. The mechanism used gives no interpretation of how the Observation_item.item_identifier is interpreted or how the data is accessed. For example, the identifier could be the number of the entity in a Part 21 file. Interpretation of this entity and its attributes may be defined through reference data.

the access comment informs the user about how to access the data. This may include or imply a description what associated entities are accessed as part of the message. For example, reference to a product entity may also bring with it any that applies to it.

provides a reference mechanism to any entity or object referenced in the message.
The Observation_item.item_identifier should provide a unique reference to the item referred to in the message, however there is no useful way of specifying this.

the type of the item. The format and value will be given through reference data.
A product in a part 21 file may be given the type 'part 21 entity'. A log file from built in equipment may be given the type 'equipment log file'.

An Observation_relationship is a relationship between two observations. The nature of this relationship is identified by the role. Where there is a structural relationship between Observations, the semantics of the structure are identified by the classification of the Observation_relationship against reference data. The of a persistant fault is composed of a series of Observations of occurances of the same fault. That is, Observation_relationship.related points to the composite , while Observation_relationship.relating points to one actual of the occurance. The Observation_relationship.role of the relationship is "observed instance", while it is classified as "is composed of". In this example, the component will apply to and the consequence will be to rectify the individual faults, while the composite will apply to a and the consequence will be a design change.
the other instance of that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other then this attribute shall be the dependent one.
one instance of that is a part of the relationship.
the role of the relationship.
